abstract: New York City continues to grapple with problem of inadequate facilities to shelter over 60,000 homeless youth, issue on which de Blasio administration has failed to make strides despite campaign pledge from mayor.
lead_paragraph: As New York City wrestles with an overall homeless population of more than 60,000, young people pose a challenge not just in terms of providing shelter for them, but also in providing the right kind of shelter.

headline.main: Housing Homeless Youth Poses Challenge for Mayor de Blasio
headline.print_headline: Campaign Promise to House Homeless Youths Poses Challenge for de Blasio

snippet: As New York City wrestles with an overall homeless population of more than 60,000, young people pose a challenge not just in terms of providing shelter for them, but also in providing the right kind of shelter.
